title: Pro- and Anti-Americanism in Sub-Saharan Africa
abstract: Journal Article Pro- and Anti-Americanism in Sub-Saharan Africa Get access Felicity Duncan, Felicity Duncan Annenberg School for Communication, University of Pennsylvania, USA Felicity Duncan is a doctoral candidate in Communication. She holds an MA in Media and Society from the University of Missouri-Columbia. Her research interests include comparative political communication, social movements, new communication technologies, and journalism. Search for other works by this author on: Oxford Academic Google Scholar Devra C. Moehler, Devra C. Moehler Annenberg School for Communication, University of Pennsylvania, USA Devra C. Moehler is an assistant professor at the Annenberg School for Communication at the University of Pennsylvania. She received her Ph.D. in Political Science from the University of Michigan and her first book, Distrusting Democrats: Outcomes of Participatory Constitution-Making (2008) was published by University of Michigan Press. Her research interests include political communication, public opinion, democratization, democracy and governance promotion, and African politics. Search for other works by this author on: Oxford Academic Google Scholar Laura R. Silver Laura R. Silver Annenberg School for Communication, University of Pennsylvania, USA Laura Silver is a doctoral candidate in Political Science and Communication. She holds an MA from the Annenberg School for Communication at the University of Pennsylvania. Her research interests include comparative political communication, Chinese politics, and global public opinion. Search for other works by this author on: Oxford Academic Google Scholar International Journal of Public Opinion Research, Volume 27, Issue 2, Summer 2015, Pages 220â€“243, https://doi.org/10.1093/ijpor/edu033 Published: 14 November 2014
